full_threads.body:
Hi Elizabeth,

Thanks so much for checking this and for sharing the detailed feedback.

We’ve made some updates to the form and attached a screenshot of the logic for those fields. Could you please give it another try when you have a chance and let us know if it’s now working as expected?

Looping in your IT team sounds like a great idea too — that extra insight could really help us get to the bottom of the email issue.

Really appreciate your patience while we work through this with you.

attachments.filename: If %22I will send via email separately%22 is no.png
If %22I will send via email separately%22 is yes.png

full_threads.body:
Thanks Joel - I've tried several email addresses now and only one instance of the form was received - which landed in a shared mailbox/not the email address that I had input into the form. The other instances of the email addresses were not received at all. We'll need to resolve this issue before the form can be made available to our customers - would it be helpful if I speak to our IT managers about this issue?

For the file upload section below - this still doesn't allow the user to proceed once they select "I will send via email" - if the user selects this option that should allow them to proceed. Also, there should only be one box as marked here - please make the title for the file drop box: "upload your contact here"



Any questions let me know

Thank you

Hi Elizabeth,

Thank for checking.

We can't seem to replicate the issue. Can you please try a different email instead?

File upload has been updated. It should be working now.

Let us know if this works for you?

Hi Joel

This is looking much better; two errors have been picked up:

The form has landed in a totally different inbox. I input my email address (Elizabeth.pace@oceanunderwriting.com.au) and the form has come through to Liability@oceanunderwriting.com.au can you check why this is happening

Section 3: the file upload option is not appearing. It also wont allow me to proceed after selecting YES to the "I will send via email" question. The user needs to be able to proceed if they select YES to this question.

Hi Elizabeth,

Thanks for sending your feedback.

We have updated the form: https://oceanunderwriting.com.au/engineers-surveyors-proposal-form-v2/

  1. All iterations of the "Next" button causes the form to return to the top of page when you click it
    - Next button should be working fine now.
  2. Need an option to upload a file here.
    Also need an additional button to tick "I will send via email separately" and if the user selects this option they should be able to proceed to the next question.
    - We have added a new field.


  3. This section doesn't auto calculate the percentages. i.e the user has to manually input the total %.
    This should auto calculate based on the inputs - are you able to do this?
    - All good on this one as well.

  4. At the final section of the form, when I hit "submit" the page returns to the top of the page. I found that when I hit the "next" button in this section the form then goes to the "we will get in touch with you shortly" page. Note the message on this page should read: Thanks for your submission. If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact your broker.
    - All done on this one as well.

We can confirm the notification is working correctly (Just a note the customer only receives it). Can you please try again?

Let us know if this works for you? Happy to tweak it.

Hi Joel - can you review the below errors that are still occurring. I am looking to finalise this form ASAP - pls let me know if you have any questions about anything that I've outlined below. Thank you.

I've tested the form twice and no confirmation email has been received; I tested with two separate emails; my oceanunderwriting address, and my Gmail address. All spam folders checked and nothing has come through.

All iterations of the "Next" button causes the form to return to the top of page when you click it



Need an option to upload a file here

Also need an additional button to tick "I will send via email separately" and if the user selects this option they should be able to proceed to the next question.



This section doesn't auto calculate the percentages. i.e the user has to manually input the total %.

This should auto calculate based on the inputs - are you able to do this?



At the final section of the form, when I hit "submit" the page returns to the top of the page. I found that when I hit the "next" button in this section the form then goes to the "we will get in touch with you shortly" page. Note the message on this page should read: Thanks for your submission. If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact your broker.

Hi Elizabeth,

Thanks so much for double-checking and letting me know.

Here’s the correct link for you to use:
https://oceanunderwriting.com.au/engineers-surveyors-proposal-form-v2

Once you’ve finished reviewing and confirming the changes, we’ll push this version live. For now, the public link hasn’t been updated yet:
https://oceanunderwriting.com.au/engineers-surveyors-proposal-form/

Appreciate your patience with this—please feel free to reach out if you run into any other issues.

Hi Joel

All the summarised errors below are still occurring for me. I've cleard the cache on this link: Engineers & Surveyors Proposal Form - Ocean Underwriting

Pls let me know urgently if there is a new link I should be using

Hi Elizabeth,

Thank you so much for your patience while we worked through these updates.

I’m happy to let you know the form has now been refreshed with the following changes:

  1. The webform is marked as spam when sending the test through – see attached email. Not sure what we can do about this?
    – We’ve updated the site and added Mailersend to help reduce the chance of emails going to spam.
  2. Step 1 of 7 – the page loads as “14% complete” can this be fixed?
    – The form now shows step numbers instead of percentages for clearer progress.
  3. Clicking yes or no to the radio button yes/no questions throughout the form pushes you back to the top of the page – can this be fixed?
    – This issue has been fixed.
  4. The date field in the last section is set in US format pls change to AU format i.e. DD/MM/YY
    – All date fields are now in AU format (DD/MM/YY).
  5. "Please provide a precise description of your business activities:"
    – This field is now required before moving forward.
  6. Income breakdown & areas of work should be mandatory to add up to 100% – it doesn’t calculate correctly
    – The section has been updated so the “Next” button is only active when the total equals 100%. A note has also been added under the fields: “Please note that total should be 100%.” (see attached example).
  7. "If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact us at fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au or call +61 9051 0708" – AMEND to: If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact your broker.
    – This message has been updated.

I’ve attached a screenshot for you to review, but please don’t hesitate to let me know if there’s anything else you’d like tweaked.

Hi Elizabeth,

Thanks for sending the feedback.

We are working on additional changes and will update you once it is done.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Team

We've done some testing and have the following feedback/edits:


  1. The webform is marked as spam when sending the test through - see attached email. Not sure what we can do about this?

  2. Step 1 of 7 - the page loads as "14% complete" can this be fixed?





  1. Clicking yes or no to the radio button yes/no questions throughout the form pushes you back to the top of the page - can this be fixed?

  2. The date field in the last section is set in US format pls change to AU format i.e. DD/MM/YY

  3. "Please provide a precise description of your business activities:" - should be mandatory to add up to 100% - it doesn't calculate correctly.

  4. Income breakdown & areas of work should be mandatory to add up to 100% - it doesn't calculate correctly

  5. "If the answer to any of Question 7.4 is No, please provide further details:*" - pls remove this question

  6. "If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact us at fl@oceanunderwriting.com.au or call +61 9051 0708" - AMEND to: If you need any assistance in the meantime, please contact your broker.
